html
Class DropDown

java.lang.Object
  html.DropDown

public class DropDown
extends java.lang.Object

The class DropDown helps you generate various dropdown boxes. There is built in functionality to generate dynamic ones with just a few extra arguments to the Constructor. This class also contains various types to pre generate a drowdown with items from the database. These types can be found as static final type members in this class. Like DropDown._TYPE_COMPLEX. You can pass these types to the class to generate the corresponding drowdown. You can easily create new types in this class for further use. If you want to get the contents of this class you can get them using the standard Object.toString function. You can also add its content to another string with the += operator.

Author:
ICT09

con

Constructor Detail

DropDown

public DropDown(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String selected,
                boolean link_mode,
                java.lang.String url,
                java.lang.String extra_sql,
                Connection con,
                Type type)
Creates a drop down box using the paramaters

Parameters:
name - The name of this box inside a form
selected - Give the value of any eventual pre-selected items
link_mode - If link mode is true, this DropDown will be enhanced with javascript, to make it refresh pages on select in the browser
url - The url this Dropdown links to when using linkmode
extra_sql - Any eventual sql code, often used with where "WHERE variable=2" for example.
con - The connection object to use when filling boxes
type - The Type of DropDown to generate, you can get working types in this class, like DropDown._TYPE_SCORES

getNumbers

public static java.lang.String getNumbers(java.lang.String url,
                                          java.lang.String selected)
Generates a list of numbers from 1 to 50, when you click a number the page will navigate automaticly to the passed url. It will also add the number to the url

Parameters:
url - The url to navigate to after click
selected - the item to pre-select on advance
Returns:

getDateField

public static java.lang.String getDateField(java.lang.String day_field,
                                            java.lang.String month_field,
                                            java.lang.String year_field,
                                            int year_offset,
                                            int year_scope)
Generates a date-time picker for you

Parameters:
day_field - the name of the day field inside a html form
month_field - the name of the month field inside a html form
year_field - the name of the year field inside a html form
year_offset - the year ofset from today, how many years to go into the future.
year_scope - The scope of years to show. This is subtracted from the current year + the year offset. if ofset is 2 and scope it 100; you wil get 2 years into the future and 88 years in the past.
Returns:
